item.title: Tutorial packages
item.description: Below are the R packages that I developed for the sole purpose of studying, hence will not be maintained. The codes are well-commented to aid understanding algorithms step-by-step. Can be used for teaching or self-studying. varngc: Penalized regressions on Vector Autoregressive models. The loss functions used include penalized least square and penalized log-likelihood. The penalty include lasso and group lasso. This package is parallelizable. t.regression: Contains regression models from UWaterloo’s STAT844 course instructed by Professor Liang Kun, following the notes of Professor Wayne Oldford.

item.title: Why is Deep Learning good?
item.description: Thanks to the David Sprott’s Distinguished Lecture by Professor Trevor Hastie and questions raised by Professor Ali Ghodsi in the Q&A session today, I realized that several things about Deep Learning. Why they are so good, I think there are three reasons: For me, Deep Learning is just like a stack of linear models, so it is one way of ensemble models together with a certain structure, maybe hierarchical. Hence, the Deep Learning models usually contain more parameters than the classical models, which may explain why it can have better performance with bigger data.

item.title: Teaching Assistant
item.description: During my graduate study at University of Waterloo, I work as a teaching assistant for statistics courses in the department. Below is the list of the courses that I have assisted. ACTSC 231 Introductory Financial Mathematics Spring 2018 STAT 202 Introductory Statistics for Scientists Fall 2017 STAT 211 Introductory Statistics and Sampling for Accounting Winter 2019 STAT 230 Probability Fall 2018, Winter 2018 STAT 316 Introduction to Statistical Problem Solving by Computer Winter 2019 STAT 330 Mathematical Statistics Fall 2018, Fall 2017 STAT 331 Applied Linear Models Spring 2020 STAT 340 Computer Simulation of Complex Systems Winter 2018 STAT 341 Computational Statistics and Data Analysis Fall 2019 STAT 371 Applied Linear Models and Process Improvement for Business Head TA Spring 2018 STAT441/881 Statistical Learning - Classification Head TA Fall 2020, Fall 2019
